video.title: Microsoft Security Compliance and Identity (SC-900) - Full Course PASS the Exam
video.description:
Prepare for the Microsoft Security Compliance and Identity Certification and pass!

✏️ Course developed by Andrew Brown of ExamPro. Check out the ExamPro YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/ExamProChannel
🔗 ExamPro Cloud Obsessed Certification Training: https://www.exampro.co

☁️ Introduction
🎤 00:00:00 Meet Your Instructor
🎤 00:06:41 What is the SC 900
🎤 00:06:45 Exam Guide

☁️ Security Methodologies
🎤 00:11:35 Zero Trust Model
🎤 00:13:15 Zero Trust Principles
🎤 00:14:07 Zero Trust Pillars
🎤 00:18:01 Zero Trust Assessment Tool
🎤 00:18:45 Follow Along Zero Trust Assessment Tool
🎤 00:21:07 Shared Responsibility Model
🎤 00:24:11 Defense In Depth
🎤 00:25:57 CIA Triad

☁️ Security Concepts
🎤 00:27:53 Common Threats
🎤 00:29:25 Vulnerabilities
🎤 00:30:40 Encryption
🎤 00:31:29 Cyphers
🎤 00:32:42 Cryptographic Keys
🎤 00:33:40 Hashing and Salting
🎤 00:35:45 Digital Signatures
🎤 00:38:17 In Transit vs At Rest
🎤 00:39:34 MFA
🎤 00:40:22 SIEM
🎤 00:42:04 SOAR
🎤 00:43:16 XDR
🎤 00:44:02 EDR
🎤 00:45:38 CASB
🎤 00:47:03 Security Posture
🎤 00:49:37 CSPM
🎤 00:50:58 JIT & JEP
🎤 00:52:07 Ingress vs Egress
🎤 00:52:45 Shadow It
🎤 00:53:32 AIR
🎤 00:54:47 Threat Modeling
🎤 00:55:35 STRIDE
🎤 00:56:45 Follow Along Microsoft Threat Modeling
🎤 00:58:14 IDS IPS
🎤 01:00:09 MITRE Attack Framework
🎤 01:01:04 Follow Along Mitre Attack Framework

☁️ Privacy
🎤 01:01:56 Microsoft Privacy Principles
🎤 01:03:03 Microsoft Privacy

☁️ Identity
🎤 01:05:35 Primary Security Perimeter
🎤 01:07:11 Identity Providers

☁️ Azure AD
🎤 01:08:52 Introduction to Auzre AD
🎤 01:11:16 Active Directory vs Azure AD
🎤 01:12:21 App Registrations
🎤 01:13:02 External Identities
🎤 01:16:21 Service Principle
🎤 01:17:32 Managed Identity
🎤 01:18:55 Device Management
🎤 01:21:15 MDM & MAM
🎤 01:22:15 Windows Hello
🎤 01:23:32 Azure AD Connect
🎤 01:24:35 SSPR
🎤 01:25:18 Password Protection

🎤 01:27:32 Emergency Access Accounts

☁️ Azure AD Authentication
🎤 01:28:45 Authentication Methods
🎤 01:29:20 Microsoft Authenticator
🎤 01:29:47 Follow Along Microsoft Authenticator
🎤 01:30:39 Biometrics
🎤 01:31:29 FIDO and Security Keys
🎤 01:32:55 Open Authentication
🎤 01:34:02 Passwordless Authentication

☁️ Azure AD Management
🎤 01:35:29 Conditional Access
🎤 01:38:28 Azure AD Roles
🎤 01:39:13 RBAC

☁️ Azure AD Protection Governance
🎤 01:40:32 Identity Governance
🎤 01:41:24 HCM
🎤 01:42:23 Identity Lifecycle
🎤 01:43:54 Access Lifecycle
🎤 01:44:45 Privilege Access Lifecycle
🎤 01:45:22 Entitlement Management
🎤 01:46:52 PIM
🎤 01:47:50 Identity Protection
🎤 01:48:37 Detection and Remediation
🎤 01:50:02 Investigation

☁️ Azure NSG
🎤 01:51:13 NSG Rules
🎤 01:52:14 Default Security Rules
🎤 01:52:54 Security Rules Logic
🎤 01:55:00 NSG Combinations

☁️ Azure Firewall
🎤 01:58:16 Azure Firewall

☁️ Azure DDoS Protection

☁️ Azure WAF

🎤 03:10:19 M365 Audit

☁️ Azure Security Concepts
🎤 03:11:20 Resource Locks

🎤 03:16:07 Cloud Adoption Framework

🎤 03:21:31 Follow Along Microsoft Security Best Practices
🎤 03:22:46 SAS
🎤 03:24:41 CORS
🎤 03:26:29 SDL

topLevelComment.author: Carlone Rosse
topLevelComment.text:
Download Updated Microsoft SC-900 Practice Exam Material Here: https://www.validexamdumps.com/microsoft/sc-900-dumps
I hope this post will be useful for people who wants to take next step in their career and Pass Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals SC-900 Exam certification. The range of knowledge as you can see is wide and sometimes you need to know the details, but this will make you a better specialist and will open more opportunities in front of you. I hope you pass Microsoft SC-900 exam questions and find your name under Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals Microsoft Security, Compliance, and Identity Fundamentals !

First of I'll just say thank you for the huge effort put into this course. topLevelComment.author: lasnite
topLevelComment.text:
Thanks for this studying for my SC-900. I do wanna make a correction about something you stated:
TLS is the prevailing security protocol, not SSL. TLS 1 & 1.1 have been deprecated. We all should be using 1.3. Alternatively, there are no versions of SSL which have not been deprecated.

topLevelComment.author: Rod MacPherson
topLevelComment.text: Important note. this video says SSL replaced TLS. This is NOT true. It is the other way around. TLS replaced SSL. We are currently on TLS 1.3, most sites will not accept anything less than TLS 1.2   SSL (all versions) has been considered unsafe for decades, but we still refer to all that as SSL sometimes out of old habits.

topLevelComment.author: Nico S
topLevelComment.text: Unfortunately I feel that this video could have been a lot better. True, there's a wealth of information described, but it is really difficult to follow and stay focused. The speed of the speaker is way too fast and at 0.75 he sounds like drunk and that way it is even more annoying to listen to. Additionally, there are some errors in what is written and what he says. It is really a pity, but at this stage I prefer the sc900 study cram from John savill.

topLevelComment.author: Super Nova
topLevelComment.text: 35mins in and getting frustrated with the video format. Most slides begin with "Welcome back blah blah...". It only takes 3-4 seconds but its just plain annoying after the umpteenth time. I understand the video being broken into sections but the You Tube video is just one long video with no markers. I know its free on You Tube but wow the adverts really ruin the flow. Sorry if I appear negative and I will try to complete the video but there are other SC-900 You Tube videos out there which at this stage make for more comfortable viewing...
